title: How to Find a Girl Who Likes Crossdressers (for Young Men)

steps.headline: Make a profile on a site that features alternative or LGBTQ dating.
steps.description: Sign up for a free dating website that has special features for crossdressers and people with non-cis preferences and lifestyles. All you need to do is provide your name (or alias as a username), email, and answer a questionnaire about the type of girl you’re looking for. Add a photo to get more likes and messages! Women who identify as lesbian or bisexual are likely to be more open to dating crossdressers. Make sure your photo is clear, well-lit, and shows you looking your best! Sites like AdultFriendFinder, Crossdresser Dating Site, and FriendFinder-x are good places to start. Some sites (like Crossdresser Hookup) are particularly geared toward no-strings-attached hookups (not relationships), so know what you’re looking for before you sign up! If you come across someone you like on one of these sites, send them a friendly message to find out if they’re into dating crossdressers. For instance, you could say, “Hey, your profile caught my eye. I see that you’re bisexual, so I’m curious if you’re into crossdressing men?”

steps.headline: Take part in online forums geared toward crossdressing.
steps.description: Go to LGBTQ-friendly online forums to chat with people about your lifestyle. Note that some forums don’t allow usernames, real names, emails, or phone numbers, so mind those rules. These types of forums aren't exactly dating sites, but you can connect with other crossdressers for tips and dating advice. Trans Pulse and Crossdresser Heaven are good places to ask questions, comment on existing posts, or create your own thread and strike up some conversation. Sites specifically geared toward crossdressing (like CrossDressers.com) is a good place to ask for dating advice and all things crossdressing.

steps.headline: Join meetup groups to find people who crossdress and like crossdressers.
steps.description:
Sites like meetup.com allow you to connect and hang out with people who are nonjudgmental of alternative lifestyles. If you live in a small city, you may not find a crossdressing group, but you can always create your own or join an LGBTQ group. To see the location of current crossdressing meetup groups, go to https://www.meetup.com/topics/crossdressers/

Single women who like crossdressers probably won’t attend crossdressing meetup groups, but you never know! If not, at least you can get some dating advice from other crossdressers. You may have to play with wording and format to properly search for groups. For instance, if “crossdressing” doesn’t come up, do another search for “cross-dressers” or something more specific like “crossdressing MTF.”
If you live in a rural area that is hostile toward alternative lifestyles, be extremely cautious if you choose to create a group. For example, do not use a real name or photo. Research prospective members before allowing them into the group and do not publicly advertise the location of meetups.

steps.headline: Hang out at LGBTQ-friendly places.
steps.description:
Go to restaurants, bars, and coffee shops that won’t judge you for your lifestyle. Often times, these places will be located in the “gay district” of your city. If you live in a smaller city, search online for LGBTQ-friendly places by typing in the name of your city and the type of place you’re looking for. For example, you might search “LGBTQ-friendly Philadelphia” or “Seattle crossdressing bars.”
For a streamlined search, you can also an LGBTQ directory like https://www.gaypinkspots.com/ or https://www.wearegayfriendly.com/

Coffee shops that are LGBTQ-friendly might have posters advertising gay, lesbian, and trans events on a bulletin board or their social media pages. Non-judgmental bars will often host LGBTQ events, drag shows, or LGBTQ musical acts. Non-gendered bathrooms are a good sign that a place is nonjudgmental and accepting. However, this isn’t always the case. Go to a travel site featuring your city like CultureMap or Lonely Planet to see a list of LGBTQ-friendly places.

steps.headline: Attend crossdressing or LGBTQ events in your local area or nearest city.
steps.description: Search your general area for clubs, bars, and other hangout spots that host crossdressing events. This could be anything from a drag show to karaoke and LGBTQ charity fundraisers. Get dolled up and mingle with other crossdressers and people who love crossdressers! If your city has an LGBTQ center, look at their website and peruse the “events” page. San Francisco, Portland, Austin, Providence, Baltimore, Philadelphia, Seattle, Salt Lake City, Los Angeles, and Orlando are the top 10 LGBTQ-friendly cities in the USA. These are places where you’re more likely to find open-minded girls who might be interested in dating crossdressing men. Do an online search for local LGBTQ charities and see what events they have coming up. Note that these events aren’t guaranteed to bring in single women looking to date crossdressers, but you can ask other crossdressers for dating advice.

steps.headline: Don’t be afraid to ask LGBTQ people or allies for advice.
steps.description:
If you cross paths with any LGBTQ people, strike up a conversation and ask them their favorite places to meet single women. For instance, you could say, “I'm new to the scene and am wondering where I can go to meet girls. Any tips?”
If you happen to meet someone who is an ally, feel free to ask them if they’re familiar with any places where you can meet single girls. And if the ally is a single girl, you might hit it off! Allies are people who do not judge you for your lifestyle. In fact, they’ll offer their enthusiastic support.

steps.headline: Shave your body hair to look more femme.
steps.description: Shave your arms, legs, and armpits to attract women who like femme-men. Women who date masculine men tend to like body hair and other highly masculine features. Shaving will finesse your look and make you more appealing. Of course, you don’t have to shave your body hair to attract a woman who will like you, but it might help to try it out and see how you like it.

steps.headline: Dress in flattering clothes to feel confident and master the look.
steps.description: Crossdressing is all about looking great while channeling some feminine energy. Stock your wardrobe with classic pumps, a little black dress, low-rise women’s jeans, classy blouses, crop tops, mini-skirts, and maybe a corset. No matter what shape you’re in, you can find something flattering and femme. Reign in wide, masculine shoulders by wearing a scoop or v-neck top to draw attention away from your shoulders. Pair a dark-colored top with a bright-colored pant or skirt to create the illusion of a smaller upper torso. Wear form-fitting pants that accentuate your hips. Belt dresses at the smallest part of your waist to create the illusion of curves.

steps.headline: Avoid costume-y clothes and styling in casual, everyday settings.
steps.description: Poofy prom dresses and buoyant wigs might be fun to wear out to a club, but they can come off as campy in most casual settings. Save the costumes for the stage and keep your everyday makeup and wardrobe cool and casual. Start with a basic piece like a simple skirt and add a statement piece like a bright, floral top. Watch online makeup tutorials to create an au-natural look that accentuates your feminine features.

steps.headline: Practice your lady walk to increase your confidence and appeal.
steps.description: Sway your hips when you walk to look more confident. Study and mimic the way other women walk to help you get the motion down. If you don’t feel confident with your femme walk, that’s okay. Just remember: confidence is sexy, so fake it ‘til you make it! Stretch out your hips to loosen them up and make the hip-sway motion easier. If you’re new to wearing heels or if you’re trying a new pair, practice walking in them a few days before you plan to go out. You don’t have to wear heels or have a feminine walk to attract women. Do what feels right for you!

steps.headline: Watch shows and movies that feature crossdressers for inspiration.
steps.description: Watch movies that feature crossdressing as a central plot point to inform your femme persona. You don’t have to change your personality at all, but it may help to get some ideas about femme mannerisms and speaking patterns from popular culture.For example, The Rocky Horror Picture Show, Hedwig and The Angry Inch, and Kinky Boots are all great films that will inspire you to craft your femme-energy. RuPaul’s Drag Race is a great show to watch to learn and get inspired! Note that some shows and films featuring crossdressing and drag can feature over-the-top representations, so take some tips but tone it down for everyday or casual crossdressing. If you want to retain your masculine voice and mannerisms, that’s okay too!

tyn: Makeup (especially eyeliner and classy lipstick or gloss)
A web browser capable of looking up photos
